db:abstract.db:para: An interface for exposure related camera settings.

db:section.db:title: Detailed Description
db:section.db:para: CameraExposure allows you to adjust exposure related settings like aperture and shutter speed, metering and ISO speed.
It should not be constructed separately, instead the exposure property of the a Camera should be used.

Several settings have both an automatic and a manual mode. In the automatic modes the camera software itself will decide what a reasonable setting is, but in most cases these settings can be overridden with a specific manual setting.
For example, to select automatic shutter speed selection:
Or for a specific shutter speed:
You can only choose one or the other mode.

db:section.db:title: [read-only] aperture : real
db:section.db:para: This property holds the current lens aperture as an F number (the ratio of the focal length to effective aperture diameter).

db:section.db:title: exposureCompensation : real
db:section.db:para: This property holds the adjustment value for the automatically calculated exposure. The value is in EV units.

db:section.db:title: exposureMode : enumeration
db:section.db:para: This property holds the camera exposure mode.
The mode can be one of the following:

db:td.db:para: Use larger aperture with small depth of field.
The base value for device specific exposure modes.

db:section.db:title: [read-only] iso : int
db:section.db:para: This property holds the sensor's ISO sensitivity value.

db:section.db:title: manualAperture : real
db:section.db:para: This property holds the aperture (F number) value for capturing photos.
If the value is less than zero, the camera automatically determines an appropriate aperture value.
aperture, setAutoAperture()

db:section.db:title: manualIso : real
db:section.db:para: This property holds the ISO settings for capturing photos.
If a negative value is specified, the camera will automatically determine an appropriate value.

db:section.db:title: manualShutterSpeed : real
db:section.db:para: This property holds the shutter speed value (in seconds). If the value is less than zero, the camera automatically determines an appropriate shutter speed.
shutterSpeed, setAutoShutterSpeed()

db:section.db:title: meteringMode : enumeration
db:section.db:para: This property holds the camera metering mode (how exposure is balanced).
The mode can be one of the following:

db:td.db:para: A matrix of sample points is used to measure exposure.
An average is used to measure exposure.
A specific location (spotMeteringPoint) is used to measure exposure.

db:section.db:title: [read-only] shutterSpeed : real
db:section.db:para: This property holds the camera's current shutter speed value in seconds. To affect the shutter speed you can use the manualShutterSpeed property and setAutoShutterSpeed().

db:section.db:title: spotMeteringPoint : QPointF
db:section.db:para: The property holds the frame coordinates of the point to use for exposure metering. This point is only used in spot metering mode, and it typically defaults to the center (0.5, 0.5).

db:section.db:title: setAutoAperture()
db:section.db:para: Turn on auto aperture selection. The manual aperture value is reset to -1.0

db:section.db:title: setAutoIsoSensitivity()
db:section.db:para: Turn on auto ISO sensitivity selection. The manual ISO value is reset to -1.

db:section.db:title: setAutoShutterSpeed()
db:section.db:para: Turn on auto shutter speed selection. The manual shutter speed value is reset to -1.0
